meanings.definition: Arranged in or extending along a straight or nearly straight line.
meanings.sent1: The linear pattern of the tiles on the floor made the room look longer.
meanings.sent2: The ruler is a linear tool used for measuring straight distances.
meanings.sent3: The linear rows of trees in the orchard made it easy to find the ripe apples.
meanings.sent4: Her linear train of thought led her to the correct answer quickly.
meanings.sent5: The linear arrangement of books on the shelf made it easy to find the one she needed.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a line.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a linear style in his drawings, focusing on simple lines and shapes.
meanings.sent2: The linear equation represented the relationship between x and y in a graph.
meanings.sent3: The linear design of the dress made it look elegant and sophisticated.
meanings.sent4: His linear approach to problem-solving helped him tackle complex issues effectively.
meanings.sent5: The linear outline of the mountain against the sky was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The linear path through the forest made it easy to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The architect's design featured linear shapes and clean angles.
meanings.sent3: The linear arrangement of desks in the classroom allowed for easy movement.
meanings.sent4: Her linear handwriting made it easy to read her notes.
meanings.sent5: The linear shadows cast by the streetlights created a pattern on the sidewalk.
